title: Kevin Hart takes on fast-food chains with new vegan restaurant
description: Actor and comedian Kevin Hart opened a new vegan fast-food restaurant, Hart House, in Los Angeles. The eatery wants to go after other fast-food chains by offering flavorful plant-based alternatives to everyone.

title: Father and daughter go viral with Harry Styles concert outfit
description: Nari Rampersad knew he had to dress the part if he was going to go to the Harry Styles concert with his daughter.  Social media praised his efforts.

title: Several killed in clashes in Baghdad's Green Zone after powerful cleric announces withdrawal from politics
description: Powerful Iraqi Shia cleric Muqtada al-Sadr announced on Monday that he was withdrawing from political life, triggering a new wave of protests inside Baghdad's heavily fortified Green Zone.

title: Former Ukrainian President: This is what's needed for a ceasefire
description: Former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko speaks with CNN's Jim Sciutto about "several factors" he thinks are necessary for a ceasefire with Russia.

title: Breaking bad habits: Routines trump willpower
description: If you're like many Americans, you probably start your day with a cup of coffee -- a morning latte, a shot of espresso or maybe a good ol' drip brew.

title: 'Are you kidding me?': Deputy finds goat in patrol car
description: Deputy Casey Thrower of the Madison County Sheriff's office in Alabama, records the moment he returns to his patrol car and sees two goats eating his paperwork. HLN's Robin Meade has the report.

title: Honda, LG announce $4.4 billion US battery factory for EVs
description: Honda has struck a deal with Korean battery giant LG Energy Solution to build a $4.4 billion US factory to supply its electric vehicles.

title: Angola's ruling party extends 47-year streak with election win
description: Angolan President João Lourenço has secured another five-year term after winning the most competitive election in the country's democratic history, according to results issued Monday by the electoral commission.

title: Legalizing recreational cannabis increases its use, research shows
description: People in US states that legalized recreational cannabis use it 20% more frequently than those in states that didn't legalize it, a study published Thursday in the journal Addiction has suggested.

title: Analysis: 'Slow burn' of Russia's economy has begun
description: Six months after invading Ukraine, Russia is bogged down in a war of attrition it didn't anticipate but it is having success on another front — its oil-dependent economy is in a deep recession but proving far more resilient than expected.

title: European power prices shatter records as energy crisis intensifies
description: Power prices in Europe continue to smash records, intensifying the region's energy crisis and fanning fears about access to electricity and heating as the weather begins to cool.

title: 'Limited set of materials' found at Mar-a-Lago potentially covered by attorney-client privilege, DOJ says
Britney Spears posts 22-minute audio addressing conservatorship
description: Britney Spears, who last November celebrated a legal victory that freed her from a 13-year conservatorship that controlled her personal and professional life, is sharing more about her experience during that time.

title: 1 of the 3 Dutch soldiers wounded in a shooting outside an Indianapolis hotel has died
description: A Dutch soldier died in Indianapolis Sunday night after he and two others were wounded in a shooting this weekend at a hotel there, the Dutch Ministry of Defense said in a statement.

title: See volunteers use bedframe to rescue people from deadly floods
description: Severe rain and floods have killed more than 1,100 people in Pakistan since mid-June, according to the country's national disaster management authority.

title: Taylor Swift channels flapper chic in a crystal Oscar de la Renta number
Sydney Sweeney defends family celebration: 'Stop making assumptions'
description: Sydney Sweeney is commenting on the backlash her family has received over photos from her mom's 60th birthday party.

title: Starbucks' Pumpkin Spice Latte is coming back at a higher price
description: Not even Starbucks' Pumpkin Spice Latte is immune to inflation.

title: Detroit Police arrest man accused of randomly shooting 4 people, mayor says
description: A man accused of randomly shooting four people in four separate shootings Sunday morning has been arrested, according to authorities.

title: Social media companies like Twitter can't be trusted to regulate themselves
description: The latest bombshell about Twitter's alleged lack of security and potential vulnerabilities is yet another sign that social media networks shouldn't be trusted to regulate themselves.

title: Monkeypox vaccine strategy shift yields more supply for some, hurdles for others
description: Most places in the United States with heavy monkeypox caseloads have shifted their vaccination strategies to the Biden administration's low-dose, intradermal approach -- and they are reporting varying results so far.

title: Turkish pop star placed under house arrest over joke about religious schools
description: A Turkish court has placed pop music singer Gulsen Bayraktar Colakoglu under house arrest, state-run news agency Anadolu said on Monday.

title: 'Blanks keep getting filled in:' What we've learned from Trump's Mar-a-Lago docs
description: CNN legal analyst Elie Honig joins New Day to give the latest into the investigation over the classified documents discovered in former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate.

title: Racial slurs shouted at Black volleyball player
description: Marvin Richardson, father of Duke University women's volleyball player Rachel Richardson, joins CNN's Brianna Keilar to discuss how his daughter experienced racist comments made by a fan during a match between Utah's Brigham Young University and Duke.

title: Ukrainian forces have begun preparing for significant counteroffensive, US believes
description: Ukrainian forces have begun "shaping" operations in southern Ukraine to prepare the battlefield for a significant Ukrainian counteroffensive, two senior US officials briefed on the intelligence told CNN.

title: Ivory Coast's first Olympic rower competes against the odds
description: Many people dream of becoming an Olympian but only a handful ever make it.

title: New audio: Britney Spears addresses conservatorship in 22-minute clip. Listen to a portion
description: Britney Spears released a 22-minute audio recording on YouTube where she discussed her conservatorship. HLN Entertainment Correspondent Melissa Knowles has more.

title: Britain's biggest warship stops en route to US due to 'mechanical issue'
description: Britain's largest warship, the HMS Prince of Wales, has been forced to stop on its way to the US following an "emerging mechanical issue" shortly after departure, the Royal Navy has said.

title: McIlroy overturns six-shot deficit at FedEx Cup to make Tour Championship history
description: Rory McIlroy became the first golfer to lift the FedEx Cup three times after completing a sensational comeback victory at the PGA Tour Championship on Sunday.

title: Bolsonaro launches personal attack on female journalist during election debate with rival Lula
description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and his main election rival and and former President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva traded insults Sunday during a charged election debate which also saw Bolsonaro launching a deeply personal attack on a journalist who questioned his response to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Are tech stocks getting burned again?
description: Burning Man is back in Silicon Valley. But this year, the biggest tech companies aren't in celebration mode.

title: Barcelona's Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang robbed in home, according to officials
description: FC Barcelona striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang was robbed in his home near Barcelona early Monday, the Catalan government Interior Department press office told CNN.

title: Libya suffered its deadliest fighting in years. Here's what to know about the crisis
description: Libya's worst fighting for two years suddenly hit the capital, Tripoli, on Saturday. This explains what led to the violence, why it matters, and how things may play out.

title: Two Air France pilots suspended after cockpit fight
description: Two Air France pilots were involved in an inflight altercation and exchanged "inappropriate gestures" while in the cockpit of an A320 heading from Geneva to Paris, the airline confirmed on Monday.

title: Accidental poisoning of children by button batteries is on the rise, study finds
description: An increasing number of little children are eating small lithium batteries, also known as "button" batteries, that power many of our consumer devices, with potentially serious consequences, even death, a new report found.

title: China charges dozens over brutal attack on women in restaurant
description: Chinese authorities have charged 28 people and detained eight police officials following a brutal assault on a group of women earlier this summer that shocked the country and provoked widespread anger.

title: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers admits to misleading media about Covid-19 vaccination status last season
description: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers admitted to misleading the media about his Covid-19 vaccination status last season during an appearance on the 'Joe Rogan Podcast' on Saturday.

title: China's yuan slid to the weakest in two years as hawkish fed signals more rate hikes
description: The Chinese yuan sank to the lowest level in two years after hawkish comments by Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell spurred a recent rally for the greenback.

title: Why China's response to US warships in Taiwan Strait surprised analysts
Tank stops traffic as Malaysian army vehicles break down two days in a row
description: The Malaysian army has apologized after two of its vehicles broke down in Kuala Lumpur on two consecutive days, blocking traffic and inviting derision on social media.

title: New Zealand police identify children whose remains were found in suitcases
description: Police in New Zealand have identified two children whose remains were found earlier this month in suitcases bought by a family in an online auction.

title: 'They have eaten themselves': Video shows emaciated animals at sanctuary
description: The Black Jaguar White Tiger Foundation in Mexico has been raided by officials with videos showing emaciated lions and other animals. CNN's Rafael Romo has more.
